verses.verse: Now the people <WH5971> became <WH1961> like those who complain <WH596> of adversity <WH9563> in the hearing <WH241> of the Lord; <WH3068> and when the Lord <WH3068> heard <WH8085> [it,] His anger <WH639> was kindled, <WH2734> and the fire <WH784> of the Lord <WH3068> burned <WH1197> among them and consumed <WH398> [some] of the outskirts <WH7097> of the camp. <WH4264>
The people <WH5971> therefore cried <WH6817> out to Moses, <WH4872> and Moses <WH4872> prayed <WH6419> to the Lord, <WH3068> and the fire <WH784> died <WH8257> out.
So the name <WH8034> of that place <WH4725> was called <WH7121> Taberah, <WH8404> because <WH3588> the fire <WH784> of the Lord <WH3068> burned <WH1197> among them.

And the rabble <WH628> who <WH834> were among <WH7130> them had <WH183> greedy <WH8378> desires <WH183>; <WH8378> and also <WH1571> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> wept <WH1058> again <WH7725> and said, <WH559> "Who <WH4310> will give us meat <WH1320> to eat <WH398>?

"We remember <WH2142> the fish <WH1710> which <WH834> we used to eat <WH398> free <WH2600> in Egypt, <WH4714> the cucumbers <WH7180> and the melons <WH20> and the leeks <WH2682> and the onions <WH1211> and the garlic, <WH7762>
but now <WH6258> our appetite <WH5315> is gone. <WH3002> There <WH369> is nothing <WH369> at all <WH3605> to look <WH5869> at except <WH1115> this manna. <WH4478> "
Now the manna <WH4478> was like coriander <WH1407> seed, <WH2233> and its appearance <WH5869> like that of bdellium. <WH916>

The people <WH5971> would go <WH7751> about <WH7751> and gather <WH3950> [it] and grind <WH2912> [it] between two millstones <WH7347> or <WH176> beat <WH1743> [it] in the mortar, <WH4085> and boil <WH1310> [it] in the pot <WH6517> and make <WH6213> cakes <WH5692> with it; and its taste <WH2940> was as the taste <WH2940> of cakes <WH3955> baked <WH3955> with oil. <WH8081>
And when the dew <WH2919> fell <WH3381> on the camp <WH4264> at night, <WH3915> the manna <WH4478> would fall <WH3381> with it.

Now Moses <WH4872> heard <WH8085> the people <WH5971> weeping <WH1058> throughout their families, <WH4940> each <WH376> man <WH376> at the doorway <WH6607> of his tent; <WH168> and the anger <WH639> of the Lord <WH3068> was kindled <WH2734> greatly, <WH3966> and Moses <WH4872> was displeased. <WH7489> <WH5869>

So Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to the Lord, <WH3068> "Why <WH4100> hast Thou been so hard <WH7489> on Thy servant <WH5650>? And why <WH4100> have I not found <WH4672> favor <WH2580> in Thy sight, <WH5869> that Thou hast laid <WH7760> the burden <WH4853> of all <WH3605> this <WH2088> people <WH5971> on me?

"Was it I who conceived <WH2029> all <WH3605> this <WH2088> people <WH5971>? Was it I who brought <WH3205> them forth, <WH3205> that Thou shouldest say <WH559> to me, 'Carry <WH5375> them in your bosom <WH2436> as a nurse <WH539> carries <WH5375> a nursing <WH3243> infant, <WH3243> to the land <WH127> which <WH834> Thou didst swear <WH7650> to their fathers'?

"Where <WH4480> <WH370> am I to get meat <WH1320> to give <WH5414> to all <WH3605> this <WH2088> people <WH5971>? For they weep <WH1058> before <WH5921> me, saying, <WH559> 'Give <WH5414> us meat <WH1320> that we may eat! <WH398>'
"I alone <WH905> am not able <WH3201> to carry <WH5375> all <WH3605> this <WH2088> people, <WH5971> because <WH3588> it is too <WH4480> burdensome <WH3515> for me.

"So if <WH518> Thou art going to deal <WH6213> thus <WH3602> with me, please <WH4994> kill <WH2026> me at once, <WH2026> if <WH518> I have found <WH4672> favor <WH2580> in Thy sight, <WH5869> and do not let me see <WH7200> my wretchedness. <WH9567>"

The Lord <WH3068> therefore said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "Gather <WH622> for Me seventy <WH7657> men <WH376> from the elders <WH2205> of Israel, <WH3478> whom <WH834> you know <WH3045> to be the elders <WH2205> of the people <WH5971> and their officers <WH7860> and bring <WH3947> them to the tent <WH168> of meeting, <WH4150> and let them take <WH3320> their stand <WH3320> there <WH8033> with you.

"Then I will come <WH3381> down <WH3381> and speak <WH1696> with you there, <WH8033> and I will take <WH680> of the Spirit <WH7307> who <WH834> is upon you, and will put <WH7760> [Him] upon them; and they shall bear <WH5375> the burden <WH4853> of the people <WH5971> with you, so that you shall not bear <WH5375> [it] all alone. <WH905>

"And say <WH559> to the people, <WH5971> 'Consecrate <WH6942> yourselves for tomorrow, <WH4279> and you shall eat <WH398> meat; <WH1320> for you have wept <WH1058> in the ears <WH241> of the Lord, <WH3068> saying, <WH559> "Oh <WH4310> that someone <WH4310> would give us meat <WH1320> to eat! <WH398> For we were well-off in Egypt. <WH4714> "Therefore the Lord <WH3068> will give <WH5414> you meat <WH1320> and you shall eat. <WH398>

'You shall eat, <WH398> not one <WH259> day, <WH3117> nor <WH3808> two days, <WH3117> nor <WH3808> five <WH2568> days, <WH3117> nor <WH3808> ten <WH6235> days, <WH3117> nor <WH3808> twenty <WH6242> days, <WH3117>

but a whole <WH3117> month, <WH2320> until <WH5704> <WH834> it comes <WH3318> out of your nostrils <WH639> and becomes <WH1961> loathsome <WH2214> to you; because <WH3282> <WH3588> you have rejected <WH3988> the Lord <WH3068> who <WH834> is among <WH7130> you and have wept <WH1058> before <WH6440> Him, saying, <WH559> "Why <WH4100> did we ever <WH2088> leave <WH3318> <WH4480> Egypt <WH4714>?"' "

But Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "The people, <WH5971> among <WH7130> whom <WH834> I am, are 600000 on foot; <WH7273> yet Thou hast said, <WH559> 'I will give <WH5414> them meat <WH1320> in order that they may eat <WH398> for a whole <WH3117> month. <WH2320>'

"Should flocks <WH6629> and herds <WH1241> be slaughtered <WH7819> for them, to be sufficient <WH4672> for them? Or <WH518> should all <WH3605> the fish <WH1709> of the sea <WH3220> be gathered <WH622> together for them, to be sufficient <WH4672> for them?"

And the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "Is the Lord's power <WH3027> limited <WH9527>? Now <WH6258> you shall see <WH7200> whether My word <WH1697> will come <WH7136> true <WH7136> for you or <WH518> not."

So Moses <WH4872> went <WH3318> out and told <WH1696> the people <WH5971> the words <WH1697> of the Lord. <WH3068> Also, he gathered <WH622> seventy <WH7657> men <WH376> of the elders <WH2205> of the people, <WH5971> and stationed <WH5975> them around <WH5439> the tent. <WH168>

Then the Lord <WH3068> came <WH3381> down <WH3381> in the cloud <WH6051> and spoke <WH1696> to him; and He took <WH680> of the Spirit <WH7307> who <WH834> was upon him and placed <WH5414> [Him] upon the seventy <WH7657> elders. <WH2205> And it came <WH1961> about that when the Spirit <WH7307> rested <WH5117> upon them, they prophesied. <WH5012> But they did not do <WH3254> [it] again. <WH3254>

But two <WH8147> men <WH376> had remained <WH7604> in the camp; <WH4264> the name <WH8034> of one <WH259> was Eldad <WH419> and the name <WH8034> of the other <WH8145> Medad. <WH4312> And the Spirit <WH7307> rested <WH5117> upon them (now they were among those who had been registered, <WH3789> but had not gone <WH3318> out to the tent <WH168>), and they prophesied <WH5012> in the camp. <WH4264>
So a young <WH5288> man <WH5288> ran <WH7323> and told <WH5046> Moses <WH4872> and said, <WH559> "Eldad <WH419> and Medad <WH4312> are prophesying <WH5012> in the camp. <WH4264>"

Then Joshua <WH3091> the son <WH1121> of Nun, <WH5126> the attendant <WH8334> of Moses <WH4872> from his youth, <WH979> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> "Moses, <WH4872> my lord, <WH113> restrain <WH3607> them."

But Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to him, "Are you jealous <WH7065> for my sake? Would <WH4310> <WH5414> that all <WH3605> the Lord <WH3068>'s people <WH5971> were prophets, <WH5030> that the Lord would put <WH5414> His Spirit <WH7307> upon them!"
Then Moses <WH4872> returned <WH622> to the camp, <WH4264> [both] he and the elders <WH2205> of Israel. <WH3478>

Now there went <WH5265> forth <WH5265> a wind <WH7307> from the Lord, <WH3068> and it brought <WH1468> quail <WH7958> from the sea, <WH3220> and let [them] fall <WH5203> beside <WH5921> the camp, <WH4264> about a day's journey <WH1870> on this <WH3541> side <WH3541> and a day's journey <WH1870> on the other <WH3541> side, <WH3541> all <WH5439> around <WH5439> the camp, <WH4264> and about two cubits <WH520> [deep] on the surface <WH6440> of the ground. <WH776>

And the people <WH5971> spent <WH6965> all <WH3605> day <WH3117> and all <WH3605> night <WH3915> and all <WH3605> the next <WH4283> day, <WH3117> and gathered <WH622> the quail <WH7958> (he who gathered least <WH4591> gathered <WH622> ten <WH6235> homers <WH9149>) and they spread <WH7849> [them] out for themselves all <WH5439> around <WH5439> the camp. <WH4264>

While the meat <WH1320> was still <WH5750> between <WH996> their teeth, <WH8127> before <WH2962> it was chewed, <WH3772> the anger <WH639> of the Lord <WH3068> was kindled <WH2734> against the people, <WH5971> and the Lord <WH3068> struck <WH5221> the people <WH5971> with a very <WH3966> severe <WH7227> plague. <WH4347>
So the name <WH8034> of that place <WH4725> was called <WH7121> Kibroth-hattaavah, because <WH3588> there <WH8033> they buried <WH6912> the people <WH5971> who had been <WH183> greedy. <WH183>
From Kibroth-hattaavah the people <WH5971> set <WH5265> out for Hazeroth, <WH2698> and they remained <WH1961> at Hazeroth. <WH2698>
